goals.question: What is the distribution of the size of the nodes in the flare dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of sizes of the nodes in the dataset and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between the depth and the number of nodes in the flare dataset?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of the 'depth' and 'size' fields
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is any correlation between the depth of the nodes and the number of nodes at that depth.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the value of the 'value' field in the flare dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of values of the 'value' field and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the number of children for each node in the flare dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of number of children for each node in the dataset and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of the depth of the nodes in the flare dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of depths of the nodes in the dataset and identify any outliers.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flare.json', orient='index')

# Plot histogram of the 'size' field
sns.histplot(data=data, x='size', kde=True, color='blue')

# Add vertical line for median
median = data['size'].median()
plt.axvline(median, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {median:.2f}')

# Add chart title and legend
plt.title('What is the distribution of the size of the nodes in the flare dataset?')
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from typing import List, Dict, Any, Tuple

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(x='depth', y='size', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between the depth and the number of nodes in the flare dataset?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flare.json')

# Plot histogram
sns.histplot(data=data, x='value', kde=True, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['value'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
plt.legend()
plt.title("What is the distribution of the value of the 'value' field in the flare dataset?", wrap=True)

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flare.json')

# Plot histogram
sns.histplot(data=data, x='children', kde=False, color='blue')
plt.axvline(data['children'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of the number of children for each node in the flare dataset?')
plt.xlabel('Number of Children')
plt.ylabel('Frequency')

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_json('flare.json', orient='index')

# Plot
sns.histplot(data=data, x='depth', color='blue', kde=True)
plt.axvline(data['depth'].median(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median Depth: {:.2f}'.format(data['depth'].median()))
plt.legend()
plt.title('What is the distribution of the depth of the nodes in the flare dataset?')
plt.xlabel('Depth')
plt.ylabel('Count')

plt.show()
```
